verses.verse: When <WG1894> He had completed <WG4137> all <WG3956> His discourse <WG4487> in the hearing <WG189> of the people, <WG2992> He went <WG1525> to Capernaum. <WG2746>
And a certain <WG5100> centurion's slave, <WG1401> who <WG3739> was highly <WG1784> regarded <WG1784> by him, was sick <WG2560> and about <WG3195> to die. <WG5053>

And when he heard <WG191> about <WG4012> Jesus, <WG2424> he sent <WG649> some Jewish <WG2453> elders <WG4245> asking <WG2065> Him to come <WG2064> and save <WG1295> the life <WG1295> of his slave. <WG1401>
And when they had come <WG3854> to Jesus, <WG2424> they earnestly <WG4709> entreated <WG3870> Him, saying, <WG3004> "He is worthy <WG514> for You to grant <WG3930> this <WG3778> to him;
for he loves <WG25> our nation, <WG1484> and it was he who built <WG3618> us our synagogue. <WG4864> "

Now <WG1161> Jesus <WG2424> [started] on His way <WG4198> with them; and when He was already <WG2235> not far <WG3112> from the house, <WG3614> the centurion <WG1543> sent <WG3992> friends, <WG5384> saying <WG3004> to Him, "Lord, <WG2962> do not trouble <WG4660> Yourself further, for I am <WG1510> not worthy <WG2425> for You to come <WG1525> under <WG5259> my roof; <WG4721>

for this <WG1352> reason <WG1352> I did not even <WG3761> consider <WG515> myself <WG1683> worthy <WG515> to come <WG2064> to You, but [just] say <WG3004> the word, <WG3056> and my servant <WG3816> will be healed. <WG2390>

"For I, too, <WG2532> am <WG1510> a man <WG444> under <WG5259> authority, <WG1849> with soldiers <WG4757> under <WG5259> me; and I say <WG3004> to this <WG3778> one, <WG3778> 'Go! <WG4198>' and he goes; <WG4198> and to another, <WG243> 'Come! <WG2064>' and he comes; <WG2064> and to my slave, <WG1401> 'Do <WG4160> this! <WG3778>' and he does <WG4160> it."

Now <WG1161> when Jesus <WG2424> heard <WG191> this, <WG3778> He marveled <WG2296> at him, and turned <WG4762> and said <WG3004> to the multitude <WG3793> that was following <WG190> Him, "I say <WG3004> to you, not even <WG3761> in Israel <WG2474> have I found <WG2147> such <WG5118> great <WG5118> faith. <WG4102>"
And when those <WG3588> who had been sent <WG3992> returned <WG5290> to the house, <WG3624> they found <WG2147> the slave <WG1401> in good <WG5198> health. <WG5198>

And it came <WG1096> about soon <WG1836> afterwards, <WG1722> <WG1836> that He went <WG4198> to a city <WG4172> called <WG2564> Nain; <WG3484> and His disciples <WG3101> were going <WG4848> along <WG4848> with Him, accompanied <WG2532> by a large <WG4183> multitude. <WG3793>

Now <WG1161> as He approached <WG1448> the gate <WG4439> of the city, <WG4172> behold, <WG2400> a dead <WG2348> man was being carried <WG1580> out, the only <WG3439> son <WG5207> of his mother, <WG3384> and she was a widow; <WG5503> and a sizeable <WG2425> crowd <WG3793> from the city <WG4172> was with her.
And when the Lord <WG2962> saw <WG3708> her, He felt <WG4697> compassion <WG4697> for her, and said <WG3004> to her, "Do not weep2799."

And He came <WG4334> up and touched <WG681> the coffin; <WG4673> and the bearers <WG941> came <WG2476> to a halt. <WG2476> And He said, <WG3004> "Young <WG3495> man, <WG3495> I say <WG3004> to you, arise! <WG1453>"
And the dead <WG3498> man <WG3498> sat <WG339> up, and began <WG757> to speak. <WG2980> And [Jesus] gave <WG1325> him back to his mother. <WG3384>

And fear <WG5401> gripped <WG2983> them all, <WG3956> and they [began] glorifying <WG1392> God, <WG2316> saying, <WG3004> "A great <WG3173> prophet <WG4396> has arisen <WG1453> among <WG1722> us!" and, "God <WG2316> has visited <WG1980> His people! <WG2992>"
And this <WG3778> report <WG3056> concerning <WG4012> Him went <WG1831> out all <WG3650> over <WG1722> Judea, <WG2453> and in all <WG3956> the surrounding <WG4066> district. <WG4066>
And the disciples <WG3101> of John <WG2491> reported <WG518> to him about <WG4012> all <WG3956> these <WG3778> things. <WG3778>

And summoning <WG4341> two <WG1417> of his disciples, <WG3101> John <WG2491> sent <WG3992> them to the Lord, <WG2962> saying, <WG3004> "Are You the Expected <WG2064> One, or <WG2228> do we look <WG4328> for someone <WG243> else <WG243>?"

And when the men <WG435> had come <WG3854> to Him, they said, <WG3004> "John <WG2491> the Baptist <WG910> has sent <WG649> us to You, saying, <WG3004> 'Are You the Expected <WG2064> One, or <WG2228> do we look <WG4328> for someone <WG243> else <WG243>?'"

At that very time <WG5610> He cured <WG2323> many <WG4183> [people] of diseases <WG3554> and afflictions <WG3148> and evil <WG4190> spirits; <WG4151> and He granted <WG5483> sight <WG991> to many <WG4183> [who were] blind. <WG5185>

And He answered <WG611> and said <WG3004> to them, "Go <WG4198> and report <WG518> to John <WG2491> what <WG3739> you have seen <WG3708> and heard: <WG191> [the] blind <WG5185> receive <WG308> sight, <WG308> [the] lame <WG5560> walk, <WG4043> [the] lepers <WG3015> are cleansed, <WG2511> and [the] deaf <WG2974> hear, <WG191> [the] dead <WG3498> are raised <WG1453> up, [the] poor <WG4434> have the gospel <WG2097> preached <WG2097> to them.
"And blessed <WG3107> is he who <WG3739> keeps <WG3361> from stumbling <WG4624> over <WG1722> Me."

And when the messengers <WG32> of John <WG2491> had left, <WG565> He began <WG757> to speak <WG3004> to the multitudes <WG3793> about <WG4012> John, <WG2491> "What <WG5101> did you go <WG1831> out into the wilderness <WG2048> to look <WG2300> at? A reed <WG2563> shaken <WG4531> by the wind <WG417>?

"But what <WG5101> did you go <WG1831> out to see <WG3708>? A man <WG444> dressed <WG294> in soft <WG3120> clothing <WG2440>? Behold, <WG2400> those <WG3588> who are splendidly <WG1741> clothed <WG2441> and live <WG5225> in luxury <WG5172> are [found] in royal <WG934> palaces. <WG933>
"But what <WG5101> did you go <WG1831> out to see <WG3708>? A prophet <WG4396>? Yes, <WG3483> I say <WG3004> to you, and one who is more <WG4053> than a prophet. <WG4396>

"This <WG3778> is the one about <WG4012> whom <WG3739> it is written, <WG1125> 'Behold, <WG2400> I send <WG649> My messenger <WG32> before <WG4253> Your face, <WG4383> Who <WG3739> will prepare <WG2680> Your way <WG3598> before <WG1715> You.'

" I say <WG3004> to you, among <WG1722> those born <WG1084> of women, <WG1135> there is no <WG3762> one <WG3762> greater <WG3173> than John; <WG2491> yet <WG1161> he who is least <WG3398> in the kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316> is greater <WG3173> than he."

And when all <WG3956> the people <WG2992> and the tax-gatherers heard <WG191> [this,] they acknowledged <WG1344> God's justice, <WG1344> having been baptized <WG907> with the baptism <WG908> of John. <WG2491>
But the Pharisees <WG5330> and the lawyers <WG3544> rejected <WG114> God's purpose <WG1012> for themselves, <WG1438> not having been baptized <WG907> by John.
"To what <WG5101> then <WG3767> shall I compare <WG3666> the men <WG444> of this <WG3778> generation, <WG1074> and what <WG5101> are they like <WG3664>?

"They are like <WG3664> children <WG3813> who sit <WG2521> in the market <WG58> place <WG58> and call <WG4377> to one <WG240> another; <WG240> and they say, <WG3004> 'We played <WG832> the flute <WG832> for you, and you did not dance; <WG3738> we sang <WG2354> a dirge, <WG2354> and you did not weep. <WG2799>'

" For John <WG2491> the Baptist <WG910> has come <WG2064> eating <WG2068> no <WG3361> bread <WG740> and drinking <WG4095> no <WG3383> wine; <WG3631> and you say, <WG3004> 'He has <WG2192> a demon! <WG1140>'

"The Son <WG5207> of Man <WG444> has come <WG2064> eating <WG2068> and drinking; <WG4095> and you say, <WG3004> 'Behold, <WG2400> a gluttonous <WG5314> man, <WG444> and a drunkard, <WG3630> a friend <WG5384> of tax-gatherers and sinners! <WG268>'
"Yet <WG2532> wisdom <WG4678> is vindicated <WG1344> by all <WG3956> her children. <WG5043>"
Now <WG1161> one <WG5100> of the Pharisees <WG5330> was requesting <WG2065> Him to dine <WG2068> with him. And He entered <WG1525> the Pharisee's house, <WG3624> and reclined <WG2625> [at the table.]

And behold, <WG2400> there was a woman <WG1135> in the city <WG4172> who <WG3748> was a sinner; <WG268> and when she learned <WG1921> that He was reclining <WG2621> [at the table] in the Pharisee's house, <WG3614> she brought <WG2865> an alabaster <WG211> vial <WG211> of perfume, <WG3464>

and standing <WG2476> behind <WG3694> [Him] at His feet, <WG4228> weeping, <WG2799> she began <WG757> to wet <WG1026> His feet <WG4228> with her tears, <WG1144> and kept wiping <WG1591> them with the hair <WG2359> of her head, <WG2776> and kissing <WG2705> His feet, <WG4228> and anointing <WG218> them with the perfume. <WG3464>

Now <WG1161> when the Pharisee <WG5330> who had invited <WG2564> Him saw <WG3708> this, he said <WG3004> to himself, <WG1438> "If <WG1487> this <WG3778> man <WG3778> were a prophet <WG4396> He would know <WG1097> who <WG5101> and what <WG4217> sort <WG4217> of person <WG4217> this <WG3588> woman <WG1135> is who <WG3748> is touching <WG681> Him, that she is a sinner. <WG268>"

And Jesus <WG2424> answered <WG611> and said <WG3004> to him, "Simon, <WG4613> I have <WG2192> something <WG5100> to say <WG3004> to you." And he replied, <WG5346> "Say <WG3004> it, Teacher. <WG1320>"
"A certain <WG5100> moneylender <WG1157> had <WG1510> two <WG1417> debtors: <WG5533> one <WG1520> owed <WG3784> five <WG4001> hundred <WG4001> denarii, <WG1220> and the other <WG2087> fifty. <WG4004>
"When they were unable <WG3361> <WG2192> to repay, <WG591> he graciously <WG5483> forgave <WG5483> them both. <WG297> Which <WG5101> of them therefore <WG3767> will love <WG25> him more <WG4183>?"

Simon <WG4613> answered <WG611> and said, <WG3004> "I suppose <WG5274> the one whom <WG3739> he forgave <WG5483> more. <WG4183>" And He said <WG3004> to him, "You have judged <WG2919> correctly. <WG3723>"

And turning <WG4762> toward <WG4314> the woman, <WG1135> He said <WG5346> to Simon, <WG4613> "Do you see <WG991> this <WG3778> woman <WG1135>? I entered <WG1525> your house; <WG3614> you gave <WG1325> Me no <WG3756> water <WG5204> for My feet, <WG4228> but she has wet <WG1026> My feet <WG4228> with her tears, <WG1144> and wiped <WG1591> them with her hair. <WG2359>
"You gave <WG1325> Me no <WG3756> kiss; <WG5370> but she, since <WG575> the time I came <WG1525> in, has not ceased <WG1257> to kiss <WG2705> My feet. <WG4228>
"You did not anoint <WG218> My head <WG2776> with oil, <WG1637> but she anointed <WG218> My feet <WG4228> with perfume. <WG3464>

" For this <WG3739> reason <WG5484> I say <WG3004> to you, her sins, <WG266> which are many, <WG4183> have been forgiven, <WG863> for she loved <WG25> much; <WG4183> but he who <WG3739> is forgiven <WG863> little, <WG3641> loves <WG25> little. <WG3641>"
And He said <WG3004> to her, "Your sins <WG266> have been forgiven. <WG863>"

And those <WG3588> who were reclining <WG4873> [at the table] with Him began <WG757> to say <WG3004> to themselves, <WG1438> "Who <WG5101> is this <WG3778> [man] who <WG3739> even <WG2532> forgives <WG863> sins <WG266>?"
And He said <WG3004> to the woman, <WG1135> "Your faith <WG4102> has saved <WG4982> you; go <WG4198> in peace. <WG1515>"
